trans-unit.source: Configures a timeout that helps mitigate denial of service attacks by terminating any request that takes longer than the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Configuration.SoapEnvelopeProcessingElement.ReadTimeout"></xref> property value.
The timeout value is checked on every call to <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.Read%2A> and <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToContent%2A>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Configuration.SoapEnvelopeProcessingElement"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Configuration.SoapEnvelopeProcessingElement"></xref> class using the provided <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> value.
The value of the timeout period.
Gets or sets the timeout period used to determine whether to terminate requests to mitigate against denial of service attacks.
The time to wait before terminating requests to <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader.Read"></xref> and <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToContent"></xref>.
Whether to throw an exception if the serializer encounters elements or attributes that were not in the original schema.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to throw an exception if the serializer encounters unexpected elements or attributes.
Set the <xref:System.Web.Services.Configuration.SoapEnvelopeProcessingElement.IsStrict%2A> property to `true` in order to help debug interoperation scenarios.

In general, when the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> class meets an element or attribute that it does not expect it raises an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnknownNode> event and continues processing.

(The same is true when the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayAttribute.Order%2A>, <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlElementAttribute.Order%2A>, or <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAnyElementAttribute.Order%2A> properties are used but data is sent out of order.) Setting the <xref:System.Web.Services.Configuration.SoapEnvelopeProcessingElement.IsStrict%2A> property to `true` instructs the Web services run time to handle that event and throw a <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> that contains a list of the expected elements and attributes.

Because exceptions are not thrown for all unexpected elements and attributes, the <xref:System.Web.Services.Configuration.SoapEnvelopeProcessingElement.IsStrict%2A> property should not be relied upon except as a debugging aid.
For example, unexpected `xml:lang` and `xml:space` attributes may not cause an exception.
`true` if the Web services serializer tries to detect unexpected elements or attributes; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the timeout period used to determine whether to terminate requests to mitigate against denial of service attacks.
The time to wait before terminating requests to <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader.Read"></xref> and <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToContent"></xref>.
